text: Portrait of Sultan-Agha Khanum. 17th-century Italian painting based on the engraving of 1596 by Johann Theodor de Bry. Sultan-Agha Khanum () was a Safavid queen consort of Circassian origin, as the second wife of Safavid king Tahmasp I (r. 1524–1576). She married Tahmasp I sometime before 1548, and was the sister of the Safavid-Circassian noble Shamkhal Sultan, as well as the mother of princess Pari Khan Khanum and prince Suleiman Mirza (b. 28 March 1554, Nakhchivan). ==References== ==Sources== * * * * * Category:Iranian people of Circassian descent Category:Circassian nobility Category:Safavid queens consort Category:16th-century women Category:16th-century people of the Safavid Empire
title: Sultan-Agha Khanum
